requirements.summary: Add a dedicated frontend scaffold React component for user custom code with clear TODO markers and placeholder UI.
acceptanceCriteria: A new TypeScript React component file exists in the frontend codebase dedicated to user custom code (e.g., a 'UserExtensions'/'CustomSection' component).
The file includes clear comment delimiters (e.g., 'BEGIN USER CODE' / 'END USER CODE') indicating where the user should add code.
The component renders without crashing and shows a simple placeholder (e.g., heading + short description) using existing Tailwind/shadcn styling patterns.

file_operations.description: Create an exported scaffold component (e.g., `UserExtensionsSection`) containing clearly labeled comment delimiters (BEGIN USER CODE / END USER CODE) and a minimal placeholder UI. Use the shadcn-ui Card (and related subcomponents) to match existing panel styling patterns; compose from existing UI components without modifying files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Render the new scaffold component inside the existing Control Panel screen without changing existing behavior in Edit/Interact modes.
acceptanceCriteria: The Control Panel UI renders the new scaffold section in a sensible location (e.g., in a sidebar panel or below existing panels) and remains fully functional in both Edit and Interact modes.
No existing control creation, layout editing, fullscreen, import/export, or recent signals behavior regresses.

file_operations.description: Wire `UserExtensionsSection` into the Control Panel UI (e.g., in the right sidebar stack near existing panels) so it is visible in both Edit and Interact modes, while preserving all current mode-conditional rendering and behaviors (create control button, fullscreen toggle, import/export visibility, recent signals polling). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
